A disorder of the female or male reproductive system known as infertility is characterised by the inability to conceive after 12 months or more of consistent, unprotected sexual activity.

Infertility in men is typically brought on by issues with the ejection of semen, a lack of sperm or low sperm counts, or irregular sperm shape (morphology) and motility (motion).

Infertility in women can result from a variety of conditions that affect uterus,fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and endocrine system among others.

The experts at Hope Hospital’s Fertility and Reproductive Health Center offer a variety of treatments, including:

  • Oncofertility
  • Genetic counseling
  • Male infertility
  • Reproductive surgery
  • Fertility evaluations
  • Fertility preservations
  • Fertility treatments

Why choose Hope Hospital for Fertility care?

By providing evidence-based fertility therapy at worldwide levels, we give couples the best possible chance of realising their dream of having a healthy child and fulfilling their dream of having their dream fulfilled. In order to assist in the treatment of infertility, our holistic approach seeks to achieve a balance in the mental, physical, and emotional components of a couple’s lives.

Our mission is to provide infertile couples with an alternative course of action that not only enhances their quality of life but also increases the likelihood that they will have happy, healthy children and successful homes.

Male infertility

Male infertility is a medical disease that prevents men from having children. Because infertility is a condition of the reproductive system, a male partner cannot become pregnant with a female. It can have an impact on men, women, or perhaps both. If the female does not become pregnant after more than a year of having frequent, unprotected sex between the couples, either the male partner, the female, or both of them may be experiencing infertility problems.

Currently, one in every six couples who are making every effort to become pregnant experiences infertility. On average, male infertility is the main or contributing cause of all occurrences of infertility.

Conception is a highly complex process that depends on a variety of factors, including:

  1. The male partner produces excellent sperm, while the female spouse produces excellent eggs.
  2. Clear fallopian tubes allow sperm to enter the egg.
  3. Fertilization occurs when the sperm and egg come into contact.
  4. The likelihood that the fertilized egg (embryo) will become firmly rooted inside the female uterus.

Signs of Male Infertility

The inability to conceive a child is the main symptom of male infertility. Typical signs and symptoms include:

  1. Erectile dysfunction, also known as erectile dysfunction, refers to issues with sexual function such as troubled ejaculation or low amounts of ejaculated fluid, lessened sexual desire, or the inability to sustain an erection of the penis.
  2. The presence of a bulge, swelling, or soreness around the testicles
  3. persistent respiratory illnesses
  4. Unusual breast development (Gynecomastia)
  5. Hair loss on the face and body, as well as other chromosomal or hormonal irregularities,
  6. A sperm count per ejaculation that is too low (less than 15 million per ejaculate)

Our services for male infertility

  • Prostatitis
  • Low testosterone levels
  • Prostate exams
  • Urinary tract infections
  • Erectile dysfunction
  • Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs) and Human Papilloma Virus (HPV)
  • Azoospermia
  • Varicoceles
  • Celiac disease

Our treatment for Male infertility

  • Testosterone replacement therapy is a popular method of treating males with symptomatic hypogonadism.
    • Treating STD  are done by medications such as antibiotics and antivirals
    • Treating UTIs are done with medications
    • Gamete intrafallopian transfer (GIFT) is a three-step process that entails taking the eggs, mixing them with sperm, and then placing them right away in the fallopian tubes where the egg is fertilized.
  • Invitro fertilization (IVF) is a complicated set of techniques designed to aid in child conception, assist with fertility, or prevent genetic issues.

Female infertility

Female infertility describes a woman’s failure to conceive after more than a year of unprotected contact without success. Female infertility, often known as “female factor” infertility, is the term used when the female partner is the cause of infertility. Approximately one-third of infertility is caused by female factors. Sometimes there is no recognized cause or a mix of male and female variables. Female infertility causes might be difficult to identify, but there are a variety of therapies available, depending on the cause of the infertility.

Signs of Female infertility

A condition linked to infertility in women may manifest as alterations in the menstrual cycle and ovulation. These signs include:

  1. Abnormal cycles. There is more or less bleeding than usual.
  2. Periods that are irregular. Each month, the amount of days between each menstruation fluctuates.
  3. No periods. You’ve never had a period, or your cycles have stopped completely.
  4. Painful periods. Cramps, pelvic pain, and back pain can all occur.
  5. Hot flashes
  6. Unexplained weight gain

Our services for Female infertility

  • Polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS)
  • Endometreiosis
  • Recurrent pregnancy loss
  • Dysfunctional uterine bleeding
  • Uterine fibroids

Our treatments for Female infertility

  • Frozen embryo transfer is a cycle in which previously frozen embryos from a fresh IVF or donor egg cycle are thawed before being reinserted into the woman’s uterus.
  • Invitro fertilization (IVF) is a sophisticated sequence of operations to improve fertility, prevent genetic issues, and help conceive. IVF involves retrieving mature eggs from ovaries and fertilizing them in a lab.
  • Intrauterine insemination (IUI) is a treatment method for infertility. Around the time your ovary produces one or more eggs to be fertilized, washed and concentrated sperm are directly inserted into your uterus.
  • Intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) is a procedure performed in which one sperm is put into one egg to fertilize it.
  • ovulation induction and cycle monitoring
  • Laparoscopic or hysteroscopic surgery  refers to the endoscopic examination of the uterine cavity through the cervix. It facilitates surgical intervention and permits the detection of intrauterine disease.

Assisted reproductive technology includes all fertility procedures that handle either eggs or embryos. ART methods often entail surgically removing eggs from a woman’s ovaries, fertilizing them in a lab, and either putting them back into her body or giving them to another woman.

 

Can smoking have an impact on sperm?

Yes. Regular smoking has a number of effects on sperm, according to research. These cells become smaller and move more slowly, and their DNA is also damaged. Smoking can have an effect on the seminal fluid that is ejaculated along with the sperm.

 

Most importantly, what should I remember about male infertility?

Any issues you encounter with fertility shouldn’t be put on you or your partner. In men, having little or no sperm is the main issue; in women, ovulation difficulties and blocked tubes are frequent issues. The technology and surgical equipment available today, however, allow doctors to treat many of those issues.

 

What diseases are responsible for male factor infertility?

Kidney and testicular problems can cause male infertility. Systemic diseases, metabolic problems, fevers, and infections can all hinder sperm development. Sexually transmitted infections can block and damage the reproductive system, while hereditary abnormalities like cystic fibrosis can cause sperm deficiency owing to missing vas deferens or seminal vesicles. It’s critical that you and your spouse are aware of your family’s medical history as well as your own, and that you both share it with your doctor because a variety of disorders can play a role.

 

Can steroid use for bodybuilding result in infertility?

Yes. The production of the hormones required for sperm production can be stopped by steroids administered orally or intravenously.

 

Do abnormal sperm or abnormal sperm analysis result in children who are born with birth defects?

No, not always. The likelihood of having a child with a birth defect is the same for most couples seeking fertility treatment as it is for the general population. However, there is a chance that some diseases that cause infertility, particularly hereditary diseases, will also raise the chance of having a child with birth abnormalities. Couples need a comprehensive assessment and counseling before moving forward with various assisted reproductive methods because of this.

 

IUI discomfort during the procedure? Before IUI, is the rupture checked?

IUI resembles a pap test more. Your doctor might administer anesthesia if it is necessary. When a rupture injection is administered, the follicles typically rupture between 36 and 48 hours after the injection. The sample of inseminated sperm is viable for at least 40 to 72 hours.

 

How long does the IVF process take in total?

The two main protocols are long and short. The short protocols start within the first three days of the menstrual cycle, whereas the long protocols (traditional) start after the previous cycle has been completed for 21 days.

 

How long must I remain in the hospital both during and following the procedure?

It is not necessary to stay in a hospital for the IVF operation. It is carried out on an OPD basis, which necessitates routine medical visits lasting a few hours or longer. Typically, an IVF cycle lasts between 18 and 20 days, but this can vary from case to case.

 

What distinguishes IVF and ICSI from one another?

There isn’t much of a distinction; both are in-vitro fertilization techniques. The sperm and egg  are given the chance to fertilize normally during IVF. When the parameters of the sperm are normal, this procedure is recommended. ICSI involves injecting the egg with the sperm using a needle to treat male factor infertility.

 

Is the egg retrieval procedure painful?

You will be given painkillers and be drugged so you won’t feel anything during egg retrieval. However, you can have cramps, a fullness sensation, or other discomfort following the operation or surgery.
